title: randomly banned for exploits
body:
So about a year ago my account "nimatha" got perm banned for "exploits" out of the blue... Now i wasnt to fussed as i rarely used the account and i had a main at the time.. now keep in mind i haven't used any scripts or 3rd party software so i was still quite pissed of that riot just fucked me out of an account
Though just recently my signed only smurf which is literally level 10 got banned for "exploits" - i have no fucking clue whats going wrong. there is no "3rd party" files on my computer as i literally just had it factory reset a few days ago...
ps my signed name is "mix n swirl" on the OCE servers
can somebody shed some light on this.. because ive lost 2 accounts FOR ACTUALLY NOTHING

This is really annoying because my accounts "nimatha" and "mix n swirl" i have literally done NOTHING WRONG on them i tried contacting riot support but they give you the same shit every time "you where banned for exploits and we basically cant tell you wtf you've done wrong because we are not allowed".... all that sounds like is HEY IVE FUCKED YOU OUT OF 2 ACCOUNTS ACCIDENTALLY, lets just say "we cant disclose shit" to piss you off.

I want a real riot members response and these 2 accounts to be unbanned.. i'm going to make a big fucking deal out of this until it is resolved... because i'm fed up with riots shit.

twitter.com/Tsukiyo_Power/status/566213261469958144 (announcing that he was banned)
twitter.com/Tsukiyo_Power/status/566561797592064000 (announcing that he was unbanned)

So i did as i said, BUT this is very much an edge case, given what i read on his twitter and tried to translate, he used Lol VO changer, which essentially is a program that changes what language stuff you get for your game (eg. making your OCE client and game have Japanese sound effects.)

If i recall correctly, this was an issue on riots end due to them flagging this as a script (as it edits files for you) and they ended up undoing it and flagging this program as ok (ONLY because it's not actually affecting the game.)

This sort of response however is limited to PROGRAMS not to players, if a program is flagged as a script and then later found not to be by Riot (say the start flagging Discord as a script by accident, then realize that discord is just a Comms app, and overturn the bans.) THAT is where this change comes in.

As for players in specific, PLAYERS have no way of disputing bans.

I guess I was a bit too naive. But yeah, Riot should at the very least, give precise reasons to why one is banned.

The reason they don't give specific reasons is because it fuels scripters. Knowing exactly what was detected tells them what wasn't, and sure it might be detected int he future, but if they're scripting to boost someones account and make bank, they don't care about that so long as they get their money.

This is why Riot doesn't give specifics about what someone has been detected for.

3rd party and scripting bans have the lowest false positive rate of any other ban type, which is a tiny percentage of players that see them. In the vast majority of cases where someone swears (truthfully) that they haven't used scripts, they have shared their account with someone who has, which in accordance with the ToS is the player's responsibility (the exception ofc being if their account has been compromised).

So first off, the account not originally being yours means big red flags for me. Maybe the friend who used to own the account used scripts at some point? (though if it had been a while that's unlikely). It's worth noting that this kind of account transfer/sharing is technically enough to get the account banned, since this is also against the ToS, it just doesn't happen that often unless there is scripting/boosting involved.

About MK LoL and your two weeks ban, the warning bans issue for programs like these back int he day were only one day bans, and from the screenshot you linked of the support ticket it sounds like the two week was a behaviour ban, not a scripting ban?

It is possible to be on two separate punishments at the same time if they are for different things, in this case it looks like you were banned for two weeks for behaviour, and during that ban a wave of third party perma bans went out, including one for this account.

So it is not banning you twice for one offence, rather it seems you were banned on two separate (though concurrent) occasions for two separate offences.

In the vast majority of cases like this where the player swears they have not used scripts, they have been banned because they have shared their account with someone who has. Assuming you gave the info willingly (for the purpose of a boost or to a 'friend') then this is your responsibility and you will not be getting your account(s) back. If your account was compromised then Riot could see that, or assuming they missed it they would see it once you submitted your ticket to prompt a second look.

To clarify, the copy paste answer you received from your tickets does not mean your ticket has not been read, rather it means that the agent took a second look at your account, determined that the ban was legitimate, and gave you that response in lieu of information they cannot give out. (i.e specifics on what was detected, see my response to SEKAI below).

In fact Riot did address your ticket, which I assume said something to the effect of "The ban was false can I have it removed?" to which their answer (addressing all points) was "Everything we see says the ban was legitimate, we will not remove it." Sure it feels unfair to you, but they did address your issue, just not in the way you wanted.

Since I'm not going to assume which case applies to you, I will cover all my bases. 

If you did in fact use scripts or 3rd party, congratulations, you are facing the consequences of your actions.

If you did not use scripts/3rd party but shared your account with someone who did willingly (whether you knew they would or not), then sorry but these are still the consequences. Giving out your account information in and of itself is against the ToS and can technically get you banned (though it doesn't happen all that often since there are legitimate reasons to do so) and that realm of account security is 100% on you. Riot will help you out if someone gains access to your account without your consent, but the second you give out that information of your own volition, any and all consequences are yours to face.

If you did not use scripts/3rd party but shared your account with someone who did UNwillingly then you have a case to make. If you believe your account was compromised you can communicate this to Riot and they will dig a little deeper. Assuming they can find evidence of such (which isn't hard if they know exactly what they're looking for) then you may well retrieve your account.

If you did not use scripts/3rd party and have not shared your account then you must have used something that got you detected. Contrary to popular belief macros CAN get you banned, however Riot is very careful with these so as not to ban people for using things like text macros or macros for emote spams. There is a possibility of you getting unbanned if this is the case, but it is not a guarantee.

That pretty much covers all the possibilities here. 

It's worth noting you shouldn't expect a Riot response here on boards, there are not nearly enough Rioters on OCE boards to answer everything, which is why us volunteers are around.

Knowing what I know of past cases, the detection systems and how Riot handles these cases your claims lost a lot of water when you got a "no" back from support. I'm not saying they never make mistakes, nor am I assuming you are not innocent, I am simply pointing out that all of the evidence points to you having done _something_ to get you detected.

On your side we have your word, and on Riot's we have a history of tiny numbers of false positives in the system and a long history of people lying on boards about it to try and get their accounts unbanned, so you can perhaps at least understand how the evidence is stacked against you and worry less about criticising those who assume your guilt, and worry more about proving your innocence.

Having a civil conversation with support will get you a lot further than the behaviour you demonstrate here. They obviously have good reason to believe you did something or you wouldn't have been banned.
